methods.Synopsis: If there is no current instance, create one. This will run the job on an immediate single-run schedule. If there is a current instance and the "requested_status" parameter is given, then the system will attempt to change the status of the current instance to the requested status. This is not guaranteed as there are a number of conditions which might prevent an instance from, e.g. achieving a running state when currently "suspended". The client should poll the current instance with a GET to determine whether the requested state has been achieved.

parameters.Description: The ID number of the desired Job resource

parameters.Description: TODO: This is a thing. It has two possibilities, type or id. Not sure that this is necessary in PUT.

parameters.Name: type
parameters.Description: This is an annoying enumerated list scenario where some of the list options have values themselves. There is the choice of 'user', 'site', 'disco'. 'disco' doesn't seem to require a value.

parameters.Name: services
parameters.Description: Services is an object, that has an object as its value, which in turn has a collection as its value. Not sure that this is necessary in PUT.

parameters.Name: type
parameters.Description: Should  'hostname' or 'ip_range', 'scan_depth' looks like an option too. Probably ought to be an enumerated type instead of string.

parameters.Description: TODO: Change collection to object.
